Status.description:
Can be null or one of the following:

1. `New`
2. `In Progress`
3. `Complete`
4. `Discontinued`
5. `Pending Create`
6. `Pending Provision`
7. `Provisioning Failed`
8. `Error`
9. `No Action Required`

delegateusername.description: This is the user who should be assigned as the delegate of the parent user. It must match `username` in `GetDelegateUserList` API response.

parentusername.description: this is the parent username, if not passed it will consider `userName` as parentusername

userName.description: this is user who is creating the delegation

disableModifyAccount.description: Flag to disable modify account functionality

disableNewAccountRequestIfAccountExists.description: Flag to disable new account request if account exists

disableRemoveAccount.description: Flag to disable remove account functionality

displayName.description: Name displayed in the user interface (can be different from endpoint name)

endpointname.description: Logical name for the endpoint that helps identify it easily

securitysystem.description: The security system for which you want to create an endpoint. The security system encapsulates the endpoint along with other endpoints sharing the same connections, workflows, or more.

userAccountCorrelationRule.description: Rule for correlating users to accounts

connectionName.description: Specify the name to identify the connection.

connectiontype.description: Specify a connection type. For example, if your target application is Active Directory, specify the connection type as `AD`.

description.description: Specify the description for the connection.

emailTemplate.description: Specify the email template applicable for notifications.

sslCertificate.description: Specify the SSL certificates to use for securing the connection between EIC and the target application to encrypt the data shared between them.

Delegate.description: Delegate represents a Deleate returne dfrom the Fetch Eisting Delegates List API.

username.description: This value is used in the `createDelegate` API.

userName.description: this is the user who is deleting the delegate

delegateusername.description: this is the user who should be assigned as the delegate of the parent use

parentusername.description: this is the parent username, if not passed it will consider userName as parentusername

userName.description: this is user who is updating the delegation

environmentname.description: (if exportonline is true) - Name of the environment which can be created at the following path : Admin -> Global Configurations -> Misc -> Transport -> Add New Transport

exportonline.description: (can be true or false) - Determines if package needs to be exported online

exportpath.description: (if exportonline is false) - Local path where export package will be generated

transportmembers.description: can be true or false) - option to transport members for selected objects such as SAV role

transportowner.description: (can be true or false) - option to transport owners for selected objects

updateuser.description: username of the user exporting the package

examples.msgDescription: Export Requested. If other requests are currently processing, your export will begin after they complete. You can call /transportPackageStatus API to check the status of your export.

searchCriteria.description: example "t*" or "te" or "test" to search in username or firstname or lastname for the delegate user

max.description: Maximum number of results to return. Maximium is 500.

totalCount.description: Total number of endpoints matching the criteria

GetUserRequest.description: Note - By default, if no responsefields param is passed, required attrs that will always return are username, email, statuskey, firstname, lastname, employeeid along with other attributes with nonblank values only.

responsefields.description: User attributes which you want to see in the response(for encrypted values, mention ecp<1-5>, and for hashed values, mention hcp<1-5>)

showsecurityanswers.description: "0"/"1" to display encrypted security answers for the user

username.description: Specify the username for which you want to get the user attribute details

GetUserRequest.title: GetUserRequest

packagetoimport.description: Complete path of the package that needs to be imported

updateuser.description: username of the user importing the package

Example 1.msgDescription: Import Requested. If other requests are currently processing, your import will begin after they complete. You can call /transportPackageStatus API to check the status of your import

errorCode.description: `"0"` indicates success. Other values indicate failure.

filename.description: enter the transport package zip file name in full (including the .zip extension)

operation.description: enter the type of transport request (export, import, or transfer)

requestid.description: (required only if the operation is import) - enter the request ID generated during the submission of the import request

connectionconfig.description: Connection configuration in JSON format (escaped). Supports valid case-senstive string values such as None, DropDownSingle, Table, and TableOnlyAdd

createEntTaskforRemoveAcc.description: Flag to create enterprise task for remove account

disableModifyAccount.description: Flag to disable modify account functionality

disableNewAccountRequestIfAccountExists.description: Flag to disable new account request if account exists

disableRemoveAccount.description: Flag to disable remove account functionality

displayName.description: Name displayed in the user interface

endpointname.description: Name of the endpoint to update

requestableRoleType.description: Configuration for requestable role types (available from v23.9)

requestOption.description: How roles are displayed (e.g., None, DropDownSingle, Table, TableOnlyAdd)

roleType.description: Type of role (e.g., Application, Enterprise, Enabler, Transactional, EmergencyAccess)

showOn.description: Specifies where to display roles (e.g., All, ShowOnApplicationRequest, ShowOnServiceAccountRequest)

required.description: Supports valid boolean values are true and falserequestedQuery/selectedQuery Supports string values in double quotes

roleType.description: Supports valid case-senstive string values such as Enabler, Transactional, EmergencyAccess, Enterprise, and Application

securitysystem.description: Security system that encapsulates the endpoint

showOn.description: Supports valid case-sensitive string values such as All, ShowOnApplicationRequest, and ShowOnServiceAccountRequest. specify the value to display the roles on Application Requests, Service Account Requests, or both. This parameter is available from the Release v24.6 onwards.

userAccountCorrelationRule.description: Rule for correlating users to accounts

UpdateTaskRequestInfo.description:
1. `updatetype` (if this is set to "completetask" then refer completetask api and pass appropriate params as well),
1. `comments`
1. `provisioningComments`
1. `provisioningMetadata`
1. `password`
1. `status`
1. `ticketId`
1. `taskownerusergroup`
1. `taskowneruser`
1. `updateuser` - username of user who is updating the task,
1. `completeassociatedtasks` - true / false,
1. `emailto`
1. `notify` - to pick up data from the task, supported values - "notify":["USER","requestor","MANAGER"],
1. `from`
1. `subject`
1. `emailbody`

status.description:
Use the following numeric status codes to represent the following status. These string status values are returned in the `checkTaskStatus` endpoint.
1: New
2: In Progress
3: Complete
4: Discontinued
5: Pending Create
6: Pending Provision
7: Provisioning Failed
8: Error
9: No Action Required

UpdateTaskRequestInfo.title: UpdateTaskRequestInfo

pathLocation.description: Should be set to `Datafiles` to upload to `job.ecm.imp.file.path` in `InternalConfig.groovy`, or `SAV` to upload to `job.ecm.savfile.path` in `InternalConfig.groovy`.

info.description: API for the Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud identity security solution covering Identity Governance and Administration (IGA), External Identity Management, Privileged Access Management, and Application Access Governance.
info.title: Saviynt EIC API

post.description: This API is used to fetch the status of any job other than Data Import Job.
This API can be used to check the task status. Response can return task status as New/Complete/In Progress/Discontinued.
This method creates a new delegate for a parent User. The input parameters of this method contains the details of the Parent User as well as the one to whom the Delegation is carried out.
Creates a new endpoint in EIC
This API is used to create job triggers.

This API call can be used to create and update a trigger for a particular `jobgroup` in Saviynt.

Starting with Release v24.7, a new `analysistypes` parameter has been introduced for the **Recommendations** job. To execute an analysis type using this API, you can use the `analysistypes` parameter and specify the following values in its request:

* 0  Run All Steps
* 1  Run Attribute Discovery
* 2  Generate Correlation Rules
* 3  Rule Consolidation for Access
* 4  Rule Consolidation for Apps
* 5  Compute Access Confidence
* 6  Compute Model Performance Statistics
* 7  Incremental Rule Creation

delete.description:
This API deletes connections in Saviynt.

Mandatory params: `updateuser`, and `connectionQuery` or `connectionkey` (If both are passed then `connectionkey` will be considered).

post.description: This API is used to delete a specific delegate.

delete.description:
Introduced in Release v24.7, this API lets administrators delete an mTLS certificate that is uploaded in the EIC keystore.

Note: Ensure that you have specified the name of the alias in the request URL.

post.description: This API call can be used to delete a trigger for a particular "jobgroup" in Saviynt.
This method is used to edit a specific delegate. The input parameters of this method contain the details of the Parent User as well as the one to whom the Delegation is carried out.
This API creates a compressed file containing objects specified for T2P migration.
This API is used to retrieve the list of existing delegates and their details. If any optional parameter is not specified then only active delegates are displayed.

This API call return job metadata for the last run of a job in Saviynt.

Note: The structure of the result param in response can change based upon the Job History saved in Saviynt

This API returns connection details in Saviynt.

Mandatory params: `connectiontype` or `connectionname` (if both are passed then `connectionkey` will be considered).
This API returns list of Connections in Saviynt.

get.description: This API returns list of users that are allowed to be added as delegate for a parentuser in SSM.

post.description: Returns a list of endpoints based on the specified filters

get.description:
Introduced in Release v24.7, this API enables administrators to view the details of mTLS certificates that are uploaded in the EIC keystore.

A thumbprint is an unique identification of the certificate. The thumbprints attribute of this API provides a unique identification of the certificate. It displays expiry and thumbprint details in the following order:

* Leaf certificate
* Intermediate certificate
* Root certificate

post.description: This method returns a List of Users in Saviynt.

This API imports a compressed file containing objects specified for T2P migration.

Supported objects:

savRoles, emailTemplate, roles, analyticsV1, analyticsV2, globalConfig, workflows, connection, appOnboarding, userGroups, scanRules, organizations, securitySystems

Starting with Release v23.10, the `resumePauseJobs` API enables you to pause jobs based on their job type and job name.

When a job is paused, its status is displayed as Paused on the Job Control Panel page.

This API call can be used to run a job trigger in Saviynt.

The following cases illustrate different scenarios on the usage of the `analyticsAdvanceQuery` parameter in the API:

* Case 1: When you configure the `analyticsAdvanceQuery` within the payload, set the `defaultActionForAnalytics` as `"true"`, and then execute the control from the API, it overrides the default action and the advanced query configuration within the job trigger.
* Case 2: When you configure the `analyticsAdvanceQuery` within the payload, set the `defaultActionForAnalytics` as `"false"`, and then execute the control from the API without performing the default actions configured in the control, it overrides the default action and the advanced query configuration within the job trigger.
* Case 3: When you do not configure both the `analyticsAdvanceQuery` and the `defaultActionForAnalytics`x, the default action will depend on the configuration provided in the analytics job trigger.

The following cases illustrate different scenarios on the usage of the `analyticsCategories` parameter in the API:

* Case 1: When you set the "defaultActionForAnalytics" as "true" to perform default actions for analytics controls by executing the control from job API, it will override the default action configuration within the job trigger.
* Case 2: When you set the "defaultActionForAnalytics" as "false" to not perform default actions for analytics controls by executing the control from job API, it will override the default action configuration within the job trigger.
* Case 3: When the defaultActionForAnalytics parameter is not set in the payload, the default action will depend on the configuration provided in the analytics job trigger.
This API can be used send an email from Saviynt.

This API is used to save and test a connection.

Mandatory params: `connectiontype`, `connectionName` OR `connectionkey` (if both are passed `connectionkey` is considered) Additional connection parameters can also be passed - For example, for SAP Import, provide paramters - `JCO_ASHOST`, `JCO_SYSNR`, `JCO_CLIENT`, `JCO_USER`, `PASSWORD`.

This API is enhanced to update vaultconnection, and vaultconfiguration connection details.

From Release v23.10, if you specify the key value for header response as standard, a detailed error message is displayed in the Response that enables you to troubleshoot errors.

get.description:
This API obtains the status of the transport request (import, export, or transfer), and helps in confirming whether the transport was completed successfully or failed.

Note: This API returns the status of only those requests that have been processed using the Enhanced Transport feature.

put.description: Updates an existing endpoint in EIC

post.description: It can update certain params of a task as well as complete a task.
Introduced in Release v24.7, this API lets administrators upload Mutual Transport Layer Security (mTLS) certificates in the EIC keystore.
This API call can be used to upload the file in a specific location based on the property `job.ecm.imp.file.path` or  `job.ecm.savfile.path` in `InternalConfig.groovy`.

get.description: This API returns all out-of-the-box (OOTB) and custom SAV roles along with their properties.
This API returns a list of users associated with a particular SAV role.

parameters.description: Specifies the number of retrieved results
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specifies the number of rows of the result to skip before any rows are retrieved, and must be used with the `limit` parameter
parameters.name: offset

get.summary: Get Users Associated with a Particular SAV Role
